lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot Bartholomew_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Bart.Bart.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Bart.Bart.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* The main entry point for the Bart.Bart chatbot application.
* Handles user input, command parsing, and interaction with the Bart.ListManager.
* Initializes the Bart.ListManager and processes user commands in a loop until "bye" is entered.
BartUtils.printWithDivider("Hello! I'm Bartholomew, but you can call me Bart.Bart" + System.lineSeparator() + "      What can I do for you?");
break; // end input gracefully if no more lines
BartUtils.printWithDivider("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
